skill.name: dotnet-backend-patterns
skill.description: Master C#/.NET backend development patterns for building robust APIs, MCP servers, and enterprise applications. Covers async/await, dependency injection, Entity Framework Core, Dapper, configuration, caching, and testing with xUnit. Use when developing .NET backends, reviewing C# code, or designing API architectures.
skill.summary: Master C#/.NET backend development patterns for building robust APIs, MCP servers, and enterprise ap...

security_audit.summary: No data theft or malicious execution patterns were found. The files contain documentation and code templates without network calls or system access.

content.value_statement: You need consistent patterns for .NET backend design. This skill provides proven templates and practices for APIs, data access, caching, and testing.
actual_capabilities: Provide clean architecture project structure guidance
Explain dependency injection lifetimes and options patterns
Offer async and Result pattern examples
Show EF Core performance best practices
Provide Dapper repository and query patterns
limitations: Does not run code or access databases
Does not generate a full project scaffold
Does not provide deployment or hosting scripts
Does not replace official framework documentation

use_cases.title: Design a new API
use_cases.description: Plan clean architecture layers, DI setup, and async patterns for a new .NET Web API.

use_cases.title: Review repository code
use_cases.description: Check EF Core or Dapper usage for performance and reliability issues.

use_cases.title: Improve test coverage
use_cases.description: Outline unit and integration test patterns with xUnit and test doubles.

prompt_templates.title: Plan service structure
prompt_templates.prompt: Propose a clean architecture layout and DI registrations for a small .NET 8 product API.

prompt_templates.title: Optimize EF Core query
prompt_templates.prompt: Review this EF Core query and suggest performance fixes, including tracking, projections, and indexing tips.

prompt_templates.title: Design Dapper repo
prompt_templates.prompt: Draft a Dapper repository method for paged search with count, using parameters and cancellation token.

prompt_templates.title: Add caching strategy
prompt_templates.prompt: Recommend a multi level cache approach with memory and Redis, including invalidation rules.

output_examples.input: Outline a Dapper search method with pagination and total count
output: Use QueryMultiple for count and data in one roundtrip
Build WHERE clauses with parameters, not string interpolation
Apply OFFSET and FETCH with page size controls
Return items and total count as a tuple

best_practices: Use async and cancellation tokens throughout
Choose EF Core or Dapper based on workload needs
anti_patterns: Blocking on async calls with Result or Wait

faq.question: Is this skill compatible with .NET 8?
faq.answer: Yes. Examples target .NET 8 patterns and are compatible with recent LTS versions.

faq.question: What are the limits of this skill?
faq.answer: It provides guidance and templates only. It does not execute code or access data.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with an existing solution?
faq.answer: Yes. Use the patterns to refactor services, repositories, and tests incrementally.

faq.question: Does it access or store my data?
faq.answer: No. The content is static and does not read files or transmit data.

faq.question: What if the advice conflicts with my stack?
faq.answer: Use your framework constraints and adapt the patterns. Ask for alternatives if needed.

faq.question: How does it compare to generic coding skills?
faq.answer: It focuses on .NET backend patterns with EF Core, Dapper, DI, caching, and testing examples.
